sense.name: a description that is a categorization of something
sense.examples: The film star fought the label of 'dumb blonde' her entire career. The candidate doesn't exactly fit the label of conservative. It's hard to stick a label on this music, it combines folk, jazz and baroque styles. The GOTO label in this Basic program specifies where the execution occurs next.

sense.name: trade name of a recording company
sense.examples: The singer recorded mostly for the Apex label. Several independent labels were bought up by Time Warner.

sense.name: a trademark in the fashion industry
sense.examples: She has her own designer clothing label now. These shoes are a cheap label, they're only imitations of an Italian designer.

sense.name: a small marker attached to an object to identify it
sense.examples: John always snips the labels out of his T-shirts. Each plant in the display had a label with both its scientific name and common name. Mary attaches a label to the front of every backup DVD she burns.

sense.name: a radioactive isotope used to trace chemical reactions
sense.examples: The method uses selenium as the tracer label. A radioactive label was used to track a possible blockage in the lower intestine.
